alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 22 at 3:08PM MST until September 22 at 4:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Dewey-Humboldt, Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 445 PM MST. * At 248 PM MST, Doppler radar and public rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain from Dewey-Humboldt eastward towards Cherry. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inch are possible in the warned area. The Flash Flooding Warning has been extended with flash flooding ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Dewey-Humboldt This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Agua Fria River, Ash Creek, Yarber Wash, and Osborne Spring Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
